title: Random crash that seems related to community tokens

labels.name: E:DesktopCommunityBugFixesForMVP
labels.description: Misc bug fixes about communities that are due for the MVP

milestone.description:
Milestone cycles:

[Cycle 1](https://github.com/status-im/status-desktop/issues?q=is%3Aopen+is%3Aissue+milestone%3A0.14+label%3AC1): 7 July
[Cycle 2](https://github.com/status-im/status-desktop/issues?q=is%3Aopen+is%3Aissue+milestone%3A0.14+label%3AC2): 28 July 
[Cycle 3](https://github.com/status-im/status-desktop/issues?q=is%3Aopen+is%3Aissue+milestone%3A0.14+label%3AC3): 18 August


**--- Main focus ---**

**1. Token permissions to enable control of community smart contracts**
- Before a community founder can use any of the community token admin functionality, they first have to deploy Owner and Token Master contracts.
- This work involves: new empty state screen for Mint and Airdrop tokens (before current empty state screen is revealed), new flow for deploying the community's Owner and Token Master contracts in a single step, a fixed uneditable permission giving anybody who holds the Token Master token admin rights for the community should be automatically created.
- Only the holder of the single Owner token can access the Token Master airdrop, remote destruct, and view holders functions. Anybody who holds the Token Master token can access all token admin options, excluding those related to the Token Master token itself, as well as being and Admin of the community.
- This will all be explained in more detail in the designs.

Backend Epic: https://github.com/status-im/status-desktop/issues/11249

**2. Update Community Admin home screen inc control node transfer and associated dialogues**
- Remove ability for a Owner to leave a community on the computer that's running as that community's control node
- Community Admin home screen cleanup (inc. adding at least one of the three graphs, whichever is easiest to implement).
  - Graph issue: https://github.com/status-im/status-desktop/issues/11152  
  - Community overview: https://github.com/status-im/status-desktop/issues/11278

**3. Ability for user to select & manage accounts shared with each community control node**
- This item is quite a bit of work
- Touches Community settings, as well as all of the community join flows
- Backend issues: 
  - Join API: https://github.com/status-im/status-desktop/issues/11154
  - Edit API: https://github.com/status-im/status-desktop/issues/11153

**4. Encryption for token gated channels that are inside Open (not token gated) communities**
[#10998](https://github.com/status-im/status-desktop/issues/10998)

**5. Final screens and bits and bobs needed prior to public beta**
- Modal that's shown every time after login, reminding user's that Status Desktop is in Beta [#11044](https://github.com/status-im/status-desktop/issues/11044)
- The bug with 'requests to join' a community not constantly arriving, or sometimes arriving after a delay, must be fixed. [#8264](https://github.com/status-im/status-desktop/issues/8264)
- Anything that didn't get completed in 0.13 related to new share URL format
- All the outstanding bugs and small items that got pushed into the 0.14 milestone.


**--- Things that we SHOULD NOT work on during the 0.14 cycle ---**
- Messaging and UI teams shouldn't work on perf. in 0.14 (but Wallet team should!)
- Anything big mutual contacts related, other than fixing small bugs we find like #10497 #10498 #11120 #11121  (hopefully this functionality working good enough now!)

**--- Wallet Team ---**

1. Finish any outstanding work related to Activity screens (top priority - aim to have complete by July 14th)

2. Updated Wallet Settings screens UI inc. account syncing functionality  *Synced information should immediately be reflected in the UI after it is received (sometimes synced info is currently only displayed after the next app restart, this needs to be fixed)*

3. Wallet performance and memory consumption optimisations

4. Fix bugs, clean up loose ends (to get things in a good state before the work on the Mobile wallet starts)

body:
# Bug Report

## Description

I have two apps that crashed one after the other (about 3 minutes in between). I wasn't actively using them.

They are both in the same community. The one that crashed first is the owner. The other is a member to whom I airdropped a token.
The is no permission, but there is a testnet collectible.

Owner logs:

## Steps to reproduce

No idea. Probably has something to do with community tokens

#### Expected behavior

No crash

### Additional Information

- Status desktop version: Master `b5950b045cff172b82a09b9a7430fd272723cadd`
- Operating System: Ubuntu 20

Seeing the same, same bt; it's always followed by a call to `wakuext_getCommunityTokens` and then crashes somewhere inside `handleCommunityUpdates` in NIM. I usually don't survive more than 10-15 minutes

Just got it now, after 20 minutes of running fine (slightly different BT though) but still a result of `wakuext_getCommunityTokens`; another common aspect is that in every crash, there is the NIM garbage collection involved too, this time with:

```
/home/ltinkl/git/status/status-desktop/vendor/nimbus-build-system/vendor/Nim/lib/system/gc.nim(505) newObjRC1
/home/ltinkl/git/status/status-desktop/vendor/nimbus-build-system/vendor/Nim/lib/system/gc_common.nim(430) prepareDealloc`
```

Ok, I found some easy repro steps:

0. Be in a community as a member (Bob) and with an Owner (Alice) that you also control
1. Open Bob's account and open the community (to make sure it was active at least once)
2. Open Alice's account in another instance
3. Have Alice perform any type of community update (edit the description)
Bob should crash.

I think the `getCommunityTokens` is a red herring. It,s just that when `communityEdited` is called, we get the tokens again to rebuild the community Item in the main module.

The crash happens because of the `dataChanged`. I'll dig deeper to see what QML tries to call that makes it crash.
I started doing a bissect and turns out the repro steps aren't that flawless. Even back on master I can't reproduce anymore with those steps. I'm not sure why that is.

> I started doing a bissect and turns out the repro steps aren't that flawless. Even back on master I can't reproduce anymore with those steps. I'm not sure why that is.

Are you bisecting just `status-desktop`? ;)

> Are you bisecting just status-desktop? ;)

I'm doing a `make clean` each time, so it should rebuild everything. It's weird. My other instance can still reproduce though, so something is maybe not built correctly. I'll try to manually remove the DOtherSide build folder

> I think the `getCommunityTokens` is a red herring. It,s just that when `communityEdited` is called, we get the tokens again to rebuild the community Item in the main module.

Yup, that's my observation too but...
 
> The crash happens because of the `dataChanged`. I'll dig deeper to see what QML tries to call that makes it crash.

It looks like the changed tokens trigger a rebuild of the permissions model which is seen by NIM as something that's no longer in use, NIM GC gets triggered while QML still holds some reference to the old data

> > Are you bisecting just status-desktop? ;)
> 
> I'm doing a `make clean` each time, so it should rebuild everything. It's weird. My other instance can still reproduce though, so something is maybe not built correctly. I'll try to manually remove the DOtherSide build folder

Yeah `make clean` really ought to do the right thing by itself :/

I have force rebuilt DOtherSide on both my accounts now and I can no longer reproduce on any of them :thinking: 

So maybe we were just missing a fix? I know Alex did a fix to DOtherSide a while ago, but I would have assumed that I would have rebuilt since then, but maybe not.

I'll leave my instances running for a while to see if one of them crashes

I think those fixes are what were missing https://github.com/status-im/status-desktop/pull/11196
and https://github.com/status-im/nimqml/pull/51

> I think those fixes are what were missing 
> #11196 and 

Ok this looks like something missing in `master`? I also noticed https://github.com/status-im/status-desktop/pull/11253 in `master`

> [status-im/nimqml#51](https://github.com/status-im/nimqml/pull/51)

while this had been later reverted in https://github.com/status-im/nimqml/pull/52

I think this is the right fix then? https://github.com/status-im/status-desktop/commit/56b616f38bd2cf7c4ac37a57c507a844a6eda344

And yeah, I haven't rebuilt DOtherSide since then so I'll try again too with a _really_ clean build

> Ok this looks like something missing in master? I also noticed https://github.com/status-im/status-desktop/pull/11253 in master

Sorry, I meant missing in terms of being built.

I just tried reintroducing the bug in DOtherSide and then I could reproduce the crash.

Then I removed the bug (added the fix back), rebuilt and I can no longer reproduce the crash...

So yeah, seems like I just never rebuilt DOTherside. OOps.

I'll close this issue
@jrainville perhaps it would be a good idea to fix the Makefile so that `make clean` really rebuilds everything needed :/

> @jrainville perhaps it would be a good idea to fix the Makefile so that `make clean` really rebuilds everything needed :/

I just tried `make clean` and it does force a rebuild of DOtherside, at least when using `make` (no run). That's why during my bissect I never got a reproduction
